channel.title: Sigil Gate on SigilGate
channel.description: Recent content in Sigil Gate on SigilGate

item.title: gRPC path rotation
item.description: It’s been on the roadmap for a while — and it’s finally done. The most vulnerable segment of the network is now protected by automatic address rotation.

item.title: First impressions of the new theme
item.description: Congo works great out of the box, but…

item.title: Choosing a theme for the Sigil Gate project
item.description: Congo as the site theme — choosing, installing, and explaining why.

item.title: Systemd timer: time to leave the cave
item.description: I’ve been using cron my whole life. Turns out there’s been something better for quite a while.

item.title: About
item.description:
SigilGate is a project focused on building private networks resistant to deep packet inspection (DPI), active probing, and regional blocking.

The project is partially open-source. We publish general architectural principles, general-purpose tools, and share our experience in the blog. At the same time, a significant part of the project remains closed: node configurations, sensitive infrastructure data, and specific organizational details are not intended for public access.

That said, we are open to dialogue with the community and willing to discuss:
